item.title: Lithuania to build fence on Belarus border to stop migrants
item.description: Tensions are running high with Belarus after a surge of non-EU migrants into Lithuania.

item.title: Poland's ruling coalition frays on eve of key media vote
item.description: The prime minister sacks his deputy, who opposed a controversial change to the country's media law.

item.title: Greece fires: Foreign teams join battle on Evia island
item.description: Several European countries are helping Greece to tackle the blazes ravaging parched forests.

item.title: Sweden tries Hamid Nouri over 1988 Iran prison massacre
item.description: Hamid Nouri faces trial over the mass execution of detainees during the Iran-Iraq war.

item.title: Lionel Messi signs two-year Paris St-Germain deal after leaving Barcelona
item.description: Lionel Messi signs a two-year deal with Paris St-Germain after leaving Barcelona.

item.title: Esther Dingley: Missing hiker's boyfriend finds her body
item.description: The body and belongings of Esther Dingley are found close to where a bone fragment was discovered.

item.title: Bronze handle suggests 'lions used' in Roman Britain executions
item.description: The bronze key handle found in Leicester shows a "Barbarian" grappling with a lion.

item.title: Wildfires: How are they linked to climate change?
item.description: A series of major wildfires across the world has hit the headlines - how do they compare to previous years?

item.title: Five things we learned from UN climate report
item.description: What are the key takeaways from the IPCC new study on the science of climate change?

item.title: Climate change: How to be more eco-friendly in everyday life
item.description: From food to fashion, green bloggers give their top tips to be more eco-friendly.

item.title: Malta: The teenagers pulled from the sea and accused of terrorism
item.description: How three teenagers rescued from the Mediterranean Sea ended up in Malta accused of terrorism.

item.title: Belarus crackdown fails to crush opposition spirit
item.description: Beaten up, jailed, forced into exile - protesters are still battling against President Lukashenko.

item.title: Lionel Messi's top 10 iconic Barcelona moments
item.description: As Lionel Messi leaves Barcelona, relive 10 of his most iconic moments for the Catalan club.

item.title: Greece fires: Hundreds rescued by coastguard
item.description: The coastguard moved 650 people from Limni, in the north of the island of Evia.

item.title: Lukashenko: 'You can choke on your sanctions in the UK'
item.description: The UK and US are tightening sanctions on Belarus, hitting economic sectors.

item.title: 'They call me the Irish hulk of basketball'
item.description: Aidan Igiehon is part of a group of elite Irish athletes playing college basketball in America.

item.title: Will Turkey's bees return after the wildfires?
item.description: Residents of Marmaris, Turkey, are mourning their bees and honey, lost to fires.

item.title: Tankus the Henge: Touring in France post-Brexit 'a puzzle'
item.description: Band Tankus the Henge negotiates touring in France, their first trip there since Brexit rules were imposed.
